args.name: Max

args.name: buildingSourceFile
args.help: path to buildings database file

bknd-0019.title: MDOF-LU

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

args.name: hazusData
args.help: Defines the location of the hazus building config data file.

args.name: stdStiffness
args.help: Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the stiffness for the building.

args.name: stdDamping
args.help: Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the damping ratio for the building.

bknd-0019.summary: Creates SAM.json file and generates script for creating a hysteretic multi-degree of freedom (MDOF) system subject to earthquake time history analysis, based on the Lu method. Analysis is executed by the OpenSeesSimulation application.

bknd-0020.title: OpenSeesInput

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

bknd-0020.summary: Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSees structural model. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesSimulation application.

bknd-0021.title: OpenSeesPyInput

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

args.name: modelPath
args.help: Defines the location of the OpenSeesPy model files.

args.name: mainScript
args.help: Defines the name of the main model file.

args.name: ndm
args.help: Defines the number of degrees of freedom in the numerical model.

args.name: dofMap
args.help: The workflow assumes X=1, Y=2, Z=3 mapping between directions and degrees of freedom; XY being the horizontal directions. This input allows you to define an alternative mapping by providing three numbers separated by commas in a string, such as '1, 3, 2' if you want to have Y as the vertical direction.

args.name: ctrlNodes
args.help: Defines the ids of the control nodes that shall be used for EDP calculations. Only the firsts n+1 nodes will be used for an n-story building.

bknd-0021.summary: Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSeesPy structural model. The functions 'build_model' and 'run_analysis' must be defined in the model script. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesPySimulation application.

bknd-0022.title: StandardEarthquakeEDP_R

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the SAM

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of file containing the EDP to be determined from the analysis

bknd-0022.summary: Creates EDP.json file containing standard EDPs for earthquake hazard events, including peak interstory drift ratio (PID), peak floor acceleration (PFA), peak roof drift (PRD), and peak floor displacement (PFD).

bknd-0023.title: UserDefinedEDP_R

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the SAM

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of file containing the EDP to be determined from the analysis

args.name: EDPspecs
args.help: Identifies the location of a json file that specifies the requested EDPs.

bknd-0023.summary: Creates EDP.json file containing EDP information which is custom-defined in an input EDP specifications file.

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of file containing the BIM

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the SAM

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of EDP file to be added to

args.name: filenameSIM
args.help: name of SIM file to be added to

bknd-0024.summary: Executes script for building structural model in OpenSees and running analysis for the response simulation, then saves the results in EDP.json.

args.name: filenameEDP

bknd-0025.summary: Executes script for building structural model in OpenSeesPy and running analysis for the response simulation, then saves the results in EDP.json.

bknd-0026.title: IMasEDP

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of file containing the BIM

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the SAM

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of EDP file to be added to

args.name: filenameSIM
args.help: name of SIM file to be added to

bknd-0026.summary: Returns the input event IM as the EDP in the absence of a response simulation method. This application is appropriate to use when damages and losses are estimated as function of IM in the DL assessment.

bknd-0027.title: Dakota-UQ

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of file containing the BIM

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the SAM

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSIM
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: driverFile
args.help: name of file containing the simulation driver

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of EDP file to be added to

args.name: method
args.help: Defines the UQ method to use.

args.name: samples
args.help: Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model.

args.name: samples2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model.

args.name: seed
args.help: Specifies the random seed.

args.name: seed2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models.

args.name: ismethod
args.help: Specifies the importance sampling method.

args.name: concurrency
args.help: Specifies the number of processes to use for simulation.

args.name: keepSamples
args.help: True if the intermediate results shall be kept for each sample.

bknd-0027.summary: Uses the uncertainty quantification package Dakota to sample random variables and execute the workflow driver file.

bknd-0028.title: pelicun

args.name: filenameDL
args.help: name of file containing the DL model information

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: name of file containing the EDP data

args.name: outputEDP
args.help: name of file to store response estimates

args.name: outputDM
args.help: name of file to store damage estimates

args.name: outputDV
args.help: name of DV file to store decision variable estimates

args.name: DL_Method
args.help: Defines the damage and loss assessment method.

args.name: Realizations
args.help: Specifies the number of realizations to generate

args.name: detailed_results
args.help: If false, only the main results are saved to improve performance.

args.name: log_file
args.help: If false, pelicun does not create a log file.

args.name: coupled_EDP
args.help: If true, the raw EDPs are used as-is without re-sampling.

args.name: event_time
args.help: Defines the time of the event in YYYY-MM-DD:HH format. 'off' turns all time-effects off.

args.name: ground_failure
args.help: If true, fragility groups associated with ground failure are added in the auto-population phase. Note that such analysis requires PGD values as inputs.

args.name: auto_script
args.help: Identifies the location of a python script that can be used to auto-populate the loss model.

bknd-0028.summary: Performs damage and loss (DL) assessment using the pelicun Python package. The application uses built-in fragility functions and the replacement cost defined in the building source file to determine damage state and loss likelihoods.

bknd-0029.title: NearestNeighborEvents

args.name: buildingFile
args.help: Name of JSON file containing an array of id,filename pairs. For each building id the aplication creates a BIM file with name filename

args.name: filenameEVENTgrid
args.help: Path to file containing location information on each event file

args.name: samples
args.help: Number of event samples to use (interesting when using more than one neighbors)

args.name: neighbors
args.help: Number of neighbors to consider for each asset.

args.name: filter_label
args.help: Custom label to use for pre-selection of grid points

bknd-0029.summary: Assigns events to building site by sampling from nearest neighboring event sites, using coordinate locations. The user specifies the number of sampled events and the number of neighbors to sample events from.
